page.title: 05Transport in the area
page.content: Until comparatively recently the area was a thriving {Coal_Mining} community.It was linked by frequent omnibus services with Carmarthen and Llanelli and surrounding villages in the valley.It was also,for nearly {40 {Years}served by a passenger railway service from{Cwmmawr}to{Burry Port}. As the ownership of cars became common the need for such transport services declined and,as a result,the area is not so well served by public transport as it used to be in the heyday of the local colliery. Since the late 1960's the local railway has carried coal and other freight;the passenger service being dis_continued as the demand for its services fell. With the closure of the colliery and the resulting outflow of workers from the area to neighbouring towns,there is a demand for more public transport.
